name: Conway's Game of Life (furtigamer)
description:
Conway's Game of Life is a cellular automaton devised by the British mathematician John Conway. 

One interacts with Conway's Game of Life by creating an initial configuration and observing how it evolves.

Rules:
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbors survives.
  • Any dead cell with three live neighbors becomes a live cell.
  • All other live cells die in the next generation. Similarly, all other dead cells stay dead.
How to play:
  • All you have to do is populate the grid with live cells and then click [Space] and let them evolve. 
  • You can pause/continue the game by pressing [Space]
  • You can place live cells by [Left Clicking].
  • You can only place live cells when the game is paused.

Have fun!
